meanings.definition: Overlapping or fitting together in a regular pattern
meanings.sent1: The imbrication tiles on the roof created a strong and sturdy structure.
meanings.sent2: The imbrication design of the wallpaper added a unique touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The imbrication puzzle pieces fit perfectly together, making it easy to solve.
meanings.sent4: The imbrication layers of rock revealed the passage of time in a beautiful way.
meanings.sent5: The imbrication pattern of the leaves on the forest floor was mesmerizing to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of overlapping or fitting together in a regular pattern
meanings.sent1: The imbrication of the shingles on the roof ensured water resistance.
meanings.sent2: The imbrication of the gears in the machine allowed for smooth operation.
meanings.sent3: The imbrication of the books on the shelf made them look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The imbrication of voices in the choir created a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The imbrication of colors in the painting gave it a sense of depth and texture.
